column1: 1 ^ The Lord is my light and my salvation~; whom shall I fear~? The Lord is the protector of my life~; of whom shall I be afraid~?
2 ^ Whilst the wicked draw near against me
column2: so as to eat my flesh
column3: they that trouble me and my enemies
column4: have been weakened and have fallen.

column1: 3 ^ If armies in camp should stand together against me
column2: my heart shall not fear. If a battle should rise up against me
column3: in this will I be confident.

column1: 4 ^ One thing I have asked of the Lord
column3: that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life~; that I may see the delight of the Lord

column1: 5 ^ For he hath hidden me in his tabernacle~; in the day of evils he hath protected me in the secret place of his tabernacle.
6 ^ He hath exalted me upon a rock
column2: and now he hath lifted up my head above my enemies. I have gone round
column3: and have offered up in his tabernacle a sacrifice of jubilation~; I will sing and I will recite a psalm to the Lord.

column4: with which I have cried to thee~; have mercy on me and hear me.

column1: 8 ^ My heart hath spoke to thee~; my face hath sought thee. Thy face
9 ^ Turn not away thy face from me~; decline not in thy wrath from thy servant. Be thou my helper~; forsake me not
column2: and do not thou despise me

column1: 10 ^ For my father and my mother have left me~; but the Lord hath taken me up.

column4: and guide me in the right path

column1: 12 ^ Let me not be delivered over to the will of them that trouble me
column2: for unjust witnesses have risen up against me
column3: and iniquity hath lied to itself.

column1: 13 ^ I believe to see the good things of the Lord in the land of the living.

column2: and let thy heart take courage
column3: and wait thou for the Lord.
